result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Marquez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample If not already done) as required by law and pay for the testing.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.

supervisions.notes:
with Huber, defendant able to go to church on Sunday's.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Marquez Jr

records.addlTxt: DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.

Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel. Defendant Juan Marquez in court with attorney James J. Ermert.  Defendant Juan Marquez in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

State requests for 1 year in RCJ consecutive to 170 days he was given credit. 
Def: Agrees with 1 year to RCJ.

BTC: 9 months in RCJ. Concurrent with any other sentence. Huber is granted. He is able to go to church on Sundays. Credit for time served.  

**NOTE:  Defendant was in custody from 4-9-17 until 11-30-17 plus 37 days given at revocation hearing for a total of 272 days credit for time served.**

Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Juan Marquez in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Defendant Juan Marquez in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Juan Marquez in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Defendant Juan Marquez in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
